title: Infective Endocarditis (IE) Mortality Risk Score
description: Predicts 6-month mortality in patients with infective endocarditis using validated clinical parameters. This risk stratification tool was developed from the International Collaboration on Endocarditis (ICE) Prospective Cohort Study and helps clinicians assess prognosis and guide treatment decisions in patients with definite infective endocarditis. The score incorporates host factors, IE characteristics, and complications to provide mortality risk prediction.

parameters.name: age_category
parameters.description: Patient age category. Older age associated with increased mortality risk

parameters.name: history_of_dialysis
parameters.description: History of chronic dialysis treatment. Dialysis patients have higher mortality risk

parameters.name: nosocomial_ie
parameters.description: Healthcare-associated infective endocarditis. Associated with worse outcomes

parameters.name: prosthetic_ie
parameters.description: Prosthetic valve infective endocarditis. Associated with higher mortality

parameters.name: symptoms_over_1_month
parameters.description: Symptoms present for more than 1 month before admission. Longer symptom duration may indicate lower acuity

parameters.name: staphylococcus_aureus
parameters.description: Staphylococcus aureus as causative pathogen. Associated with more aggressive disease

parameters.name: viridans_group_streptococci
parameters.description: Viridans group streptococci as causative pathogen. Generally associated with better prognosis

parameters.name: aortic_vegetation
parameters.description: Presence of aortic valve vegetation on echocardiography

parameters.name: mitral_vegetation
parameters.description: Presence of mitral valve vegetation on echocardiography

parameters.name: nyha_class_3_or_4_hf
parameters.description: NYHA Class 3 or 4 heart failure. Severe heart failure associated with poor prognosis

parameters.name: stroke
parameters.description: Stroke complication during IE episode. Major embolic complication

parameters.name: paravalvular_complication
parameters.description: Paravalvular complications (abscess, fistula, pseudoaneurysm). Indicates severe local tissue destruction

parameters.name: persistent_bacteremia
parameters.description: Persistent bacteremia despite appropriate antibiotic treatment. Indicates treatment failure

parameters.name: surgical_treatment
parameters.description: Surgical treatment performed during index hospitalization. Associated with improved survival when appropriately selected

ranges.interpretation: Low risk of 6-month mortality. Consider standard medical management with close monitoring.
Moderate risk of 6-month mortality. Consider intensive medical management and evaluation for surgical intervention if indicated.
High risk of 6-month mortality. Consider aggressive treatment including surgical evaluation if appropriate. Discuss prognosis with patient and family.
Very high risk of 6-month mortality. Consider palliative care consultation and goals of care discussion. Surgical intervention may be considered only in highly selected cases.

references: Gunes M, Gecmen C, Beker Evans M, et al. Validated Risk Score for Predicting 6-Month Mortality in Infective Endocarditis. J Am Heart Assoc. 2017 Apr 7;6(4):e003016. doi: 10.1161/JAHA.115.003016.

Murdoch DR, Corey GR, Hoen B, et al. Clinical presentation, etiology, and outcome of infective endocarditis in the 21st century: the International Collaboration on Endocarditis-Prospective Cohort Study. Arch Intern Med. 2009 Mar 9;169(5):463-73. doi: 10.1001/archinternmed.2008.603.
Cahill TJ, Baddour LM, Habib G, et al. Challenges in Infective Endocarditis. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2017 Jul 25;70(3):325-335. doi: 10.1016/j.jacc.2017.06.007.
formula: Score = sum of all parameter points; Probability of 6-month mortality (%) = 100 × [1 / (1 + exp(-(2.416×score + 0.109×score² - 4.849)))]
notes: Developed from the International Collaboration on Endocarditis (ICE) Prospective Cohort Study (2000-2006, n=4049)
Validated in external cohort with good discrimination (R² = 0.91-0.97)
Score ≥8 has sensitivity 86.7%, specificity 50.8%, NPV 86% for 6-month mortality
Surgery is associated with lower mortality but performed less frequently in highest risk patients
Six-month mortality after IE is approximately 25% overall
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment and multidisciplinary team assessment
Does not replace individual clinical decision-making regarding surgical timing
Score incorporates host factors, IE characteristics, and complications
Negative points for longer symptom duration and viridans group strep (better prognosis)
Positive points for advanced age, dialysis, nosocomial IE, and complications
Persistent bacteremia defined as continued positive blood cultures despite appropriate antibiotics
Paravalvular complications include abscess, fistula, or pseudoaneurysm formation
NYHA Class 3-4 heart failure indicates severe cardiac compromise
